name: Math - Two-Step Word Problems
subject: math
goalTextTemplate: By {{date}}, given a two-step word problem involving {{operation}}, {{studentName}} will solve the problem by writing an equation and finding the solution, for {{threshold}} problems, on {{condition}} progress monitoring assessments.
baselineTemplate: {{studentName}} scored {{baselineScore}} on recent assessments involving two-step word problems.
description: Template for two-step word problems that can be assessed digitally
exampleGoal: By 05/18/2026, given a two-step word problem involving addition and subtraction, EJ will solve the problem by writing an equation and finding the solution, for 3 out of 4 problems, on 3 out of 4 progress monitoring assessments.

name: Math - Multi-Step Word Problems
subject: math
goalTextTemplate: By {{date}}, given a multi-step word problem, {{studentName}} will solve the problem using appropriate strategies (e.g., drawing a picture, writing equations), for {{threshold}} problems, on {{condition}} progress monitoring assessments.
baselineTemplate: {{studentName}} scored {{baselineScore}} on recent assessments involving multi-step word problems.
description: Template for multi-step word problems that may require showing work
exampleGoal: By 05/18/2026, given a multi-step word problem, EJ will solve the problem using appropriate strategies, for 4 out of 5 problems, on 2 out of 3 progress monitoring assessments.

name: Math - Solving One-Step Equations
subject: math
goalTextTemplate: By {{date}}, when given a one-step equation (e.g., {{example}}), {{studentName}} will solve for the variable using inverse operations, with {{threshold}} accuracy, for {{condition}} sets of problems.
baselineTemplate: {{studentName}} scored {{baselineScore}} on recent assessments involving one-step equations.
description: Template for solving one-step equations
exampleGoal: By 05/18/2026, when given a one-step equation (e.g., 2x = 12), EJ will solve for the variable using inverse operations, with 80% accuracy, for 2 out of 3 sets of problems.

name: Math - Solving Two-Step Equations
subject: math
goalTextTemplate: By {{date}}, when given a two-step equation (e.g., {{example}}), {{studentName}} will solve for the variable using visual or arithmetic strategies, with {{threshold}} accuracy, for {{condition}} sets of problems.
baselineTemplate: {{studentName}} scored {{baselineScore}} on recent assessments involving two-step equations.
description: Template for solving two-step equations
exampleGoal: By 05/18/2026, when given a two-step equation (e.g., 3x - 4 = 11), EJ will solve for the variable using visual or arithmetic strategies, with 80% accuracy, for 2 out of 3 sets of problems.

name: Math - Solving Multi-Step Equations
subject: math
goalTextTemplate: By {{date}}, given a single variable, multi-step linear equation with rational coefficients, {{studentName}} will solve for the variable by using properties of operations (e.g., distributive property, inverse operations, combine like terms), for {{threshold}} equations, on {{condition}} progress monitoring assessments.
baselineTemplate: {{studentName}} scored {{baselineScore}} on recent assessments involving multi-step equations.
description: Template for solving multi-step linear equations
exampleGoal: By 05/18/2026, given a single variable, multi-step linear equation with rational coefficients, EJ will solve for the variable by using properties of operations, for 4 out of 5 equations, on 2 out of 3 progress monitoring assessments.

name: Math - Multi-Digit Operations
subject: math
goalTextTemplate: By {{date}}, {{studentName}} will accurately solve multi-digit {{operation}} problems (including with decimals and fractions) with {{threshold}} accuracy in {{condition}} trials, as measured by teacher-made assessments and classwork.
baselineTemplate: {{studentName}} scored {{baselineScore}} on recent assessments involving multi-digit {{operation}}.
description: Template for multi-digit operations with whole numbers, decimals, and fractions
exampleGoal: By 05/18/2026, EJ will accurately solve multi-digit addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division problems (including with decimals and fractions) with 80% accuracy in 4 out of 5 trials.

name: Math - Fraction Operations
subject: math
goalTextTemplate: By {{date}}, when given {{number}} {{operation}} problems with fractions ({{fractionType}}), {{studentName}} will solve the problems using appropriate strategies, with at least {{threshold}} accuracy in {{condition}} trials as measured by student work samples/teacher records.
baselineTemplate: {{studentName}} scored {{baselineScore}} on recent assessments involving fraction {{operation}}.
description: Template for fraction operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division)
exampleGoal: By 05/18/2026, when given 10 addition problems with fractions (unlike denominators), EJ will solve the problems using appropriate strategies, with at least 80% accuracy in 2 out of 3 trials.

name: Math - Decimal Operations
subject: math
goalTextTemplate: By {{date}}, when given equations involving {{operation}} of {{numberType}}, {{studentName}} will solve by using the standard algorithm with {{threshold}} accuracy (i.e., {{thresholdDetail}} problems correct) for {{condition}} sets of problems.
baselineTemplate: {{studentName}} scored {{baselineScore}} on recent assessments involving decimal {{operation}}.

variables.numberType: one whole number and one multi-digit decimal number up to the thousandths place

description: Template for decimal operations
exampleGoal: By 05/18/2026, when given equations involving addition of one whole number and one multi-digit decimal number up to the thousandths place, EJ will solve by using the standard algorithm with 80% accuracy (i.e., 4 out of 5 problems correct) for 2 out of 3 sets of problems.

name: Math - Word Problem with Algebraic Expression
subject: math
goalTitleTemplate: Writing Algebraic Expressions from Word Problems
goalTextTemplate: By {{date}}, given a word problem with {{stepCount}} operation, {{studentName}} will write the algebraic expression (e.g., {{example}}) by interpreting the word problem, with guiding questions (e.g., "What do you know? What operation makes sense here?"), for {{threshold}} statements, on {{condition}} progress monitoring assessments.
baselineTemplate: {{studentName}} scored {{baselineScore}} on recent assessments involving writing algebraic expressions.
description: Template for writing algebraic expressions from word problems
exampleGoal: By 05/18/2026, given a word problem with one operation, EJ will write the algebraic expression (e.g., x - 4) by interpreting the word problem, for 4 out of 5 statements, on 3 out of 4 progress monitoring assessments.

name: Math - Visual Fraction Models
subject: math
goalTextTemplate: By {{date}}, when given {{number}} problems and the use of visual fraction {{modelType}} to manipulate, {{studentName}} will {{action}} (e.g., {{example}}) with at least {{threshold}} accuracy in {{condition}} trials as measured by student work samples/teacher records.
baselineTemplate: {{studentName}} scored {{baselineScore}} on recent assessments involving visual fraction models.

variables.action: recognize and generate simple equivalent fractions

description: Template for fraction visual models requiring paper/manipulatives
exampleGoal: By 05/18/2026, when given 10 problems and the use of visual fraction circles to manipulate, EJ will recognize and generate simple equivalent fractions (e.g., 1/2 = 2/4, 4/6 = 2/3) with at least 70% accuracy in 2 out of 3 trials.

name: Math - Algebra Tiles
subject: math
goalTextTemplate: By {{date}}, when given an equation and algebra tiles, {{studentName}} will use the tiles to model and solve the equation, with {{threshold}} accuracy, for {{condition}} sets of problems.
baselineTemplate: {{studentName}} scored {{baselineScore}} on recent assessments involving algebra tiles.
description: Template for algebra tiles requiring physical manipulatives
exampleGoal: By 05/18/2026, when given an equation and algebra tiles, EJ will use the tiles to model and solve the equation, with 80% accuracy, for 2 out of 3 sets of problems.

name: Math - Rational Number Ordering
subject: math
goalTextTemplate: By {{date}}, when given a set of rational numbers, {{studentName}} will order them from least to greatest (or greatest to least), with {{threshold}} accuracy, for {{condition}} sets of problems.
baselineTemplate: {{studentName}} scored {{baselineScore}} on recent assessments involving ordering rational numbers.
description: Template for ordering rational numbers
exampleGoal: By 05/18/2026, when given a set of rational numbers, EJ will order them from least to greatest, with 80% accuracy, for 2 out of 3 sets of problems.

name: ELA - Reading Comprehension (Multiple Choice)
subject: ela
goalTitleTemplate: Reading Comprehension - Main Idea and Details
goalTextTemplate: By {{date}}, after reading an {{textType}} level {{textGenre}} text, {{studentName}} will answer {{number}} reading comprehension questions (multiple choice, true/false, or short answer) with {{threshold}} accuracy in {{condition}} trials by student work samples/teacher charted records.
baselineTemplate: {{studentName}} scored {{baselineScore}} on recent reading comprehension assessments.
description: Template for reading comprehension with multiple choice questions
exampleGoal: By 05/18/2026, after reading an independent level informational text, EJ will answer 5 reading comprehension questions with 80% accuracy in 2 out of 3 trials.

name: ELA - Main Idea Identification
subject: ela
goalTextTemplate: By {{date}}, after reading an {{textType}} level {{textGenre}} text, {{studentName}} will identify the main idea from {{choiceCount}} multiple choices and identify {{detailCount}} supporting details, with {{threshold}} accuracy in {{condition}} trials.
baselineTemplate: {{studentName}} scored {{baselineScore}} on recent assessments involving main idea identification.
description: Template for identifying main idea and supporting details
exampleGoal: By 05/18/2026, after reading an independent level informational text, EJ will identify the main idea from 2 multiple choices and identify 2 supporting details, with 80% accuracy in 2 out of 3 trials.

name: ELA - Making Inferences
subject: ela
goalTextTemplate: By {{date}}, after reading an {{textType}} level {{textGenre}} text, {{studentName}} will make inferences using evidence from the text, answering {{number}} inference questions with {{threshold}} accuracy in {{condition}} trials.
baselineTemplate: {{studentName}} scored {{baselineScore}} on recent assessments involving making inferences.
description: Template for making inferences from text
exampleGoal: By 05/18/2026, after reading an independent level literary text, EJ will make inferences using evidence from the text, answering 4 inference questions with 80% accuracy in 2 out of 3 trials.

name: ELA - Context Clues
subject: ela
goalTextTemplate: By {{date}}, when given {{number}} underlined words in sentences or short paragraphs, {{studentName}} will use context clues to determine the meaning of the word for {{threshold}} words on {{condition}} trials.
baselineTemplate: {{studentName}} scored {{baselineScore}} on recent assessments involving context clues.
description: Template for using context clues to determine word meaning
exampleGoal: By 05/18/2026, when given 5 underlined words in sentences or short paragraphs, EJ will use context clues to determine the meaning of the word for 4 out of 5 words on 2 out of 3 trials.

name: ELA - Vocabulary Word Meaning (Multiple Choice)
subject: ela
goalTextTemplate: By {{date}}, when given a sentence with a highlighted word and {{choiceCount}} choices, {{studentName}} will circle the meaning of the word from {{choiceCount}} choices, with {{threshold}} accuracy on {{condition}} trials as measured by student work samples and progress monitoring assessments.
baselineTemplate: {{studentName}} scored {{baselineScore}} on recent vocabulary assessments.
description: Template for vocabulary word meaning with multiple choice
exampleGoal: By 05/18/2026, when given a sentence with a highlighted word and 3 choices, EJ will circle the meaning of the word from 3 choices, with 80% accuracy on 4 out of 5 trials.

name: ELA - Citing Evidence (Written)
subject: ela
goalTextTemplate: By {{date}}, given an {{textType}} level {{textGenre}} text and a claim about the text, {{studentName}} will list {{evidenceCount}} pieces of evidence and write {{sentenceCount}} sentences to explain how it supports the claim, scoring {{rubricPoints}} out of {{totalPoints}} points for evidence and support in {{condition}} trials.
baselineTemplate: {{studentName}} scored {{baselineScore}} on recent assessments involving citing evidence.
description: Template for citing textual evidence requiring written responses
exampleGoal: By 05/18/2026, given an independent level informational text and a claim about the text, EJ will list 2 pieces of evidence and write 1-2 sentences to explain how it supports the claim, scoring 3 out of 4 points for evidence and support in 3 out of 4 trials.

name: ELA - Writing Informational Text
subject: ela
goalTextTemplate: By {{date}}, given an informative writing prompt and a {{supportType}}, {{studentName}} will write an informational text to address the prompt with an introductory statement, {{paragraphCount}} paragraphs that each have a topic sentence, sentences with details about the topic, and a conclusion statement, for {{rubricPoints}} out of {{totalPoints}} rubric points, on {{condition}} progress monitoring assessments.
baselineTemplate: {{studentName}} scored {{baselineScore}} on recent writing assessments.
description: Template for informational writing requiring paper-based assessment with rubric
exampleGoal: By 05/18/2026, given an informative writing prompt and a graphic organizer with sentence starters, EJ will write an informational text with an introductory statement, 2 paragraphs that each have a topic sentence, sentences with details about the topic, and a conclusion statement, for 5 out of 6 rubric points, on 3 out of 4 progress monitoring assessments.

name: ELA - Writing Multi-Paragraph Essay
subject: ela
goalTextTemplate: By {{date}}, given {{number}} grade level, {{textType}} texts on a topic and a writing prompt with a specified topic, {{studentName}} will write a {{paragraphCount}} paragraph essay: includes an introductory paragraph, {{bodyParagraphCount}} body paragraphs with supporting facts, and a concluding statement scoring {{rubricPoints}} out of {{totalPoints}} rubric points in {{condition}} essays.
baselineTemplate: {{studentName}} scored {{baselineScore}} on recent essay writing assessments.
description: Template for multi-paragraph essay writing requiring paper-based assessment
exampleGoal: By 05/18/2026, given 2 grade level, informational texts on a topic and a writing prompt with a specified topic, EJ will write a 4 paragraph essay: includes an introductory paragraph, 2 body paragraphs with supporting facts, and a concluding statement scoring 3 out of 5 rubric points in 2 out of 3 essays.

name: ELA - Writing Paragraph
subject: ela
goalTextTemplate: By {{date}}, given a short {{textType}} level writing prompt, {{studentName}} will write a paragraph with correct grammar and verb tense on the given topic that includes one opening sentence, {{detailCount}} supporting detail sentences, and one closing sentence in {{condition}} paragraphs.
baselineTemplate: {{studentName}} scored {{baselineScore}} on recent paragraph writing assessments.
description: Template for paragraph writing requiring paper-based assessment
exampleGoal: By 05/18/2026, given a short independent level writing prompt, EJ will write a paragraph with correct grammar and verb tense on the given topic that includes one opening sentence, 4-5 supporting detail sentences, and one closing sentence in 2 out of 3 paragraphs.

name: ELA - Summarizing Text
subject: ela
goalTextTemplate: By {{date}}, after reading a {{textType}} level {{textGenre}} text and given a prompt to summarize the text, {{studentName}} will write a summary that includes ({{ideaCount}}) central idea and ({{detailCount}}) supporting details, on ({{condition}}) progress monitoring assessments.
baselineTemplate: {{studentName}} scored {{baselineScore}} on recent summarizing assessments.
description: Template for summarizing text requiring written response
exampleGoal: By 05/18/2026, after reading a grade-level informational text and given a prompt to summarize the text, EJ will write a summary that includes (1) central idea and (3) supporting details, on (3 out of 4) progress monitoring assessments.

name: ELA - Phonics/Decoding
subject: ela
goalTextTemplate: By {{date}}, given a list of {{number}} {{textType}} reading level multisyllabic words, {{studentName}} will decode each word with {{threshold}} accuracy in {{condition}} trials as measured on a teacher-created word list.
baselineTemplate: {{studentName}} scored {{baselineScore}} on recent phonics/decoding assessments.
description: Template for phonics/decoding requiring oral reading assessment
exampleGoal: By 05/18/2026, given a list of 10 independent reading level multisyllabic words, EJ will decode each word with 80% accuracy in 2 out of 3 trials as measured on a teacher-created word list.

name: ELA - Reading Fluency
subject: ela
goalTextTemplate: By {{date}}, {{studentName}} will be able to read a {{gradeLevel}} grade text at a rate of {{targetWPM}} correct words per minute with {{threshold}} accuracy in {{condition}} trials as measured by teacher observations and charted records.
baselineTemplate: {{studentName}} read a {{gradeLevel}} grade text at a rate of {{baselineWPM}} correct words per minute with {{baselineAccuracy}} accuracy.
description: Template for reading fluency requiring running records
exampleGoal: By 05/18/2026, EJ will be able to read a fifth grade text at a rate of 110 correct words per minute with 95% accuracy in 2 out of 3 trials as measured by teacher observations and charted records.

name: Other - On-Task Behavior
subject: other
goalTextTemplate: By {{date}}, when given an in-class assignment (e.g., {{assignmentExamples}}) and a {{supportType}}, {{studentName}} will {{behaviorDescription}} for {{threshold}} assignments.
baselineTemplate: {{studentName}} demonstrates on-task behavior {{baselineDescription}}.

variables.assignmentExamples: silent reading, group project, independent writing assignment
variables.supportType: self-monitoring checklist chart to track 4 on-task behaviors
variables.behaviorDescription: self-monitor on-task skills by marking 'yes' or 'no' for each behavior at the end of the work period
variables.baselineDescription: for 5 minutes or less during group activities without the need to be redirected

description: Template for on-task behavior requiring teacher observation
exampleGoal: By 05/18/2026, when given an in-class assignment and a self-monitoring checklist chart, EJ will self-monitor on-task skills by marking 'yes' or 'no' for each behavior at the end of the work period for 4 out of 5 assignments.

name: Other - Work Completion
subject: other
goalTextTemplate: By {{date}}, given an in-class assignment and told how to turn in completed work, {{studentName}} will complete the assignment and submit it to the designated area or person by the deadline (e.g., {{deadlineExamples}}), for ({{threshold}}) assignments.
baselineTemplate: {{studentName}} completes and submits {{baselinePercentage}} of work currently in class.

variables.deadlineExamples: a specific time, when a timer goes off, the end of class

description: Template for work completion requiring teacher tracking
exampleGoal: By 05/18/2026, given an in-class assignment and told how to turn in completed work, EJ will complete the assignment and submit it to the designated area or person by the deadline, for (4 out of 5) assignments.

name: Other - Executive Functioning - Task Initiation
subject: other
goalTextTemplate: By {{date}}, given task directions, {{studentName}} will start the task and/or ask for clarification within ({{timeLimit}}), and remain on-task until completion, for ({{threshold}}) school-based tasks.
baselineTemplate: {{studentName}} takes between {{baselineTimeRange}} to start his assignment. He cannot finish it in the time allowed.
description: Template for executive functioning - task initiation and completion
exampleGoal: By 05/18/2026, given task directions, EJ will start the task and/or ask for clarification within (1 minute), and remain on-task until completion, for (4 out of 5) school-based tasks.

name: Other - Self-Advocacy
subject: other
goalTextTemplate: By {{date}}, when presented with a class-based task, {{studentName}} will demonstrate agency with regard to work habits (e.g., {{examples}}) by {{actionDescription}} as measured by a teacher-student observation form, for {{threshold}} class-based tasks.
baselineTemplate: {{studentName}} {{baselineDescription}}.

variables.actionDescription: selecting and using at least 1 strategy from a list of options to complete the task
variables.baselineDescription: struggles with completing and submitting work in the classroom

description: Template for self-advocacy requiring teacher observation
exampleGoal: By 05/18/2026, when presented with a class-based task, EJ will demonstrate agency with regard to work habits by selecting and using at least 1 strategy from a list of options to complete the task as measured by a teacher-student observation form, for 3 out of 4 class-based tasks.
